reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located close to the Circo Massimo stop on the Metro. It is also 10-15 minute walk from the Roman Forum and Colosseum.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, central but off the beaten path

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is in a residential area, which is a good thing if you wish to get a real taste of Italian food (and not the drivel served by the well known tourist spots) as there are a lot of local restaurants. All of which served food of the highest order - I never want to eat the Italian 'food' served in the UK again.
reviews.title: Ideal for romantic getaway

likes.liked: — Nice gardens between rooms and dining room/reception
likes.disliked: — Bed & pillows were a bit on the hard side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Inside the hotel, I found it to be clean, tidy and well-kept. Rooms are of a fair size and include a digital safe. The bathroom is clean and tidy, towels are replaced daily, and beds are comfortable. Unfortunately, visiting in March, the air condition was turned off due to it still being winter, so I found the room to be warmer than I'd like. Being from England, Italian winter is more like May-time weather in the UK.
reviews.title: Off the beaten track

reviews.text: Breakfast, of the continental kind, is tasty and of good quality. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Best kept secret in Roma
Positive reviews accurate
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Villa San Pio - having had a fantastic break. We found the hotel to be ideal - we tend to walk everywhere once in a city, and whilst the hotel is a bit away from the centre of Rome, it was only a 10 - 15 min walk from getting to "the sights".

reviews.title: Truly molto bene!
reviews.text: The Hotel Villa San Pio is located in a wonderfully quiet residential area in the Aventino. The rooms are large (by European Standards) with wonderful faux tromp l'oiel decor and re's the well appointed up-to-date marble bathroom (large shower only). The hotel is nestled in a wonderful small wooded mediterranean garden with terraces and balconies for everyone to enjoy. Since it was winter time, most of the furniture on the terraces had been taken in, but there were heatlamps outside on the restaurant terraces that made my evening Lemoncello cozy. The restaurant (open evenings only) is 4 star, but take a taxi "downtown" and enjoy the local flavor. The positive and negative to this hotel is it's location on the Aventine hill which requires a short site filled cab ride to the Pantheon, but, as I mentioned, it's a very quiet oasisi in a very busy loud city. The staff is very helpful and taxis are readily available and quick. The staff speaks English and the hotel is maintained impeccably. My husband and I will stay here again.

We stayed December 15-19 and enjoyed immensely. The breakfast was quite expansive and all service was impeccable. The accomodations were well appointed. What we enjoyed most was the quiet elegance of the hotel, without the hustle and traffic noises of those typically along a major thoroughfare. The sole negative thought was that it was more like a 10 minute walk to Piramide metro station which can be a somewhat daunting uphill walk after spending the day on one's feet touring Rome.
reviews.title: A Nice Get Away

reviews.text: We booked this hotel on the basis of the reviews contained on Trip Advisor. Two couples were spending a few days in Rome to celebrate a 40th birthday.
reviews.title: Nice hotel/Good location/Indifferent staff

reviews.text: The birthday boy emailed the hotel a week before to request rooms close together but received no reply. When we checked in we explained we had emailed but were advised no email had been received. The receptionist was uninterested in what the email said and when we asked for rooms close together was told there was none.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: On checking into the rooms, one did not contain a bath. The birthday boy returned to reception, requested a room with a bath and was placed only a short walk from his friends room!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel
Loved it!
reviews.text: My husband and I absolutely LOVED this hotel! Very beautiful, spacious, and clean. It's right outside the city, yet still within walking distance of the Colosseum...so it's not chaotic and loud. Very peaceful. We will absolutely stay there if we are in Rome again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a long weekend, 2nd week in Feb. It is so nice and quiet as it is in a residential area, surrounded by lovely italian villas. Once you've worked out either tram or underground, you are at all of the sites in minutes. It is about a 10 minute walk to Circus Maximus and with hours of tredding the pavement knowing at least how to get home on the public transport isn't a bad idea.
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel and retreat

reviews.text: Breakfast was lovely in the Wintergarden and we also found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. Our room was what you can expect in a 3***, matress is quite firm (but that is meant to be healthy)! Decent sized bathroom as well. In summer I would say the garden would be fab to sit out in and have a drink.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Large rooms, good food, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't eat in the hotel as there were fab restaurants locally, the real deal! Just watch out that you don't mistakenly order the sheeps intestines!! It is also close to the Trastevere area which is great for going out and buzzing with little bars and restaurants.
reviews.title: Lovely Garden Retreat in Busy Rome

likes.disliked: — Nothing, I dont mind a 10 min walk it was worth it for the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a really lovely time in Rome, and because you are out and about so much, this little quiet retreat is a bit of an oasis.
reviews.title: Oasis of rest in a loud city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Villa San Pio is a small hotel in an upscale residential area on the Aventine, a leafy retreat from crowds and bustle, but still walking distance to the ancient city center and with good access to mass transit to get everywhere else. We used both buses and the metro successfully. Our room and bath were clean and comfortable, the staff courteous and helpful. The hotel occupies three small buildings surrounded by lush landscaping, with the excellent restaurant housed on the ground floor of one. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious, with particularly good crusty rolls. Dinner was also fine, but there are a number of good, less expensive places down the hill in Testaccio if you're in the mood for something less elaborate. We particularly liked Il Cantinone, which is billed as a pizzeria but offers much more, and Remo, which is bare bones with terrific pizza. Rome is a big, busy city and staying at the Villa San Pio is a great way to be near its heart but away from it all at the same time. We found this hotel on TripAdvisor and are very grateful to the people who reviewed it before us. It's a real find and a great value.
reviews.title: Lovely Quiet Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My DH and I arrived in Rome and took the train to the Ostiense station from FCO airport. We didn't have clear directions on how to get there, just a general idea (this was my fault!) and started walking. What should have taken us 10 minutes took us 30. Upon finding the hotel, we were more happy to see it than you know! (Just make sure you know where you're going if you're planning on walking) We stepped past the property walls into the garden and even at night it's beautiful and lush. The front desk staff was friendly and checked us in quickly then helped us to our room with our bags. Our room number was 527, a nice room but no balcony. Since we were there in March the hotel was still on 'winter' mode and didn't have the air conditioner turned on. We opened a window to cool off the room and left it open all night as it was so quiet there was no noise to keep us awake.
reviews.title: Loved it once we found it!

likes.liked: — The fact that we could leave our window open all night with no problems.
likes.disliked: — That I didn't take directions on how to get here.

reviews.text: The next morning, we went down for breakfast which you can eat on either an inside patio or outside patio. They have a wide array of choices - pastries, jams, fruit, cereal, meat, juice, milk, coffee, tea. It was wonderful!
reviews.title: Great hotel - and only a little out of the way.

reviews.text: After breakfast we learned that the front desk will hold your luggage at no charge if you wish to check out and go sightseeing. So, we took advantage of that. It was a short ten minute walk up to the coliseum and forum area, and an easy walk. The walk to/from Ostiense train station is a bit hilly, even if you go the right way!
reviews.title: A gem of a hotel!

likes.disliked: — If I had to say something, one of the curtains didn't close properly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very pleasant stay at the Villa San Pio and will stay here again when we come to Rome!
reviews.title: Great Romantic Hotel, but beware...I awoke racked with pain every morning!
